Tried the much talked about hopia, which was flaky, rich, and buttery, but not particularly exotic or interesting to me.  The lumpias had a tasty filling of corn and other nondescript vegetables.  Arrived around 11am and both tasted like they'd been sitting around for a few hours.
author: Jeremy C.

description:
HOPIA!!!!!  their's is really good stuff...the best i've had in a LONG time.  almost as good as the ones i remember as a kid that we would buy from a filipino store in pasadena close to fedco (sort of unheard of considering it was the 80s and was too ahead of it's time for it's own good.  it eventually closed.  but they sold really flakey hopia in small pink boxes.  not sure where they got them--if anybody has similar memories from their childhood and knows this store, holla!).

the mongo filling is fresh and the wrapping is how i like hopia to be.  not too thin and doesn't fall apart too much.  it's got a buttery flavor too...eeek but yum!

i totally feel the review below me on the hours of the store.  they're somewhat flakey...uh, no pun intended.  heh. my parents were up there in december and had to go back 2-3 times to try and pick some up because they were told to return at a certain time. BUT when they did it wasn't open and craziness like that.  thankfully, they didn't give up on hilda.  definitely call ahead (and a few times more apparently), you can't just walk in...at least for their hopia.
author: Leni A.

description: 1 star for customer service  sucks. The owners daughter can't even smile it seems like she is force to be there at the store.No parking even in the front of the store.  They do not open on time ( 15 min late), and when they open it is cold inside and dark. The owner shows up  at 0930 ( store opens at 9:00 am) from church and asked the employee whey the light is not on.  Hopia is good and still  the same size as before  and the same price .  I will not come back again and I do not recommend this place since the are other places go.
author: Ja L.

description: Someone took me to Hilda's Mart & Bake Shop. Standing outside I was wondering where I was being taken. Inside I saw my favorite Palitau. It took me back to Via Mare / Greenbelt in the Philippines. Now I go back every week for guinitaan bilog bilog.   This place doesn't look great, but runs circles around Goldilocks and Pampanguena Cuisine.  Everyhing is freshly made.   It's kind of clinical looking.  But they get a great crowd there. Hilda's is getting my business for the holidays.  Check it out.
author: Roland P.

description:
Ay nako! Ang sarap sarap ng hopia!  In other words, oh my the hopia is so good!  

Based on the reviews on Yelp, I decided to venture out there on a Saturday afternoon, hoping that they didn't run out of any pastries.

Walked in and it was a surprisingly small store with only one glass shelf showcasing what pasteries they had.  I was a little nervous because the people in front of me were speaking and ordering in tagalog and my tagalog is a little rusty.  Thank goodness a young woman came out from the back and started speaking perfect english.  Whew!

I tried to order the ube puto, but it was already sold out. A few items that I asked for was also sold out!  I decided to go for the 12 piece Hopia and the last Karioca stick on the shelf.  Both excellent choices. The hopia came out still warm and the crust was soft and crumbly.

Suffice to say, I would definitely venture back for the amazing Hopia Mungo. I'm sure the rest of the pasteries are to die for too.
author: Ny H.

description: Their hopias are absolutely addicting! I usually don't care for hopia but hopia from Hilda's  mart is a different story. I love the flakey goodness of their hopias!
author: J V.

description: The best hopia West of the Mississippi! Hilda will not disappoint you.  She makes the BEST hopia & puto. Putoooo! Real talk. No one else compares to their hopia but if u know anywhere else that does please let me know! ***Cash only.
author: Marcia G.

description: I've driven past Hilda's quite a bit and saw it had good reviews on Yelp, plus I never had phillipino dessert before so I figured I'd give it a shot. I've read some of the negative reviews on here and for the most part people are absolutely telling the truth. The customer service isn't great (standard Asian establishment customer service), and the location makes it a pain to find parking. Also, the cash-only thing is pretty standard in SF but the good news is there are several ATMs on Mission which is 2 blocks away. I've seen them turn large orders away because the customer didn't order in advance and Hilda's didn't have enough inventory to fulfill the order. Despite all of that, the items here are very good. I think if you abide by their rules (make larger orders in advance, bring cash, and prepare to drive around a bit to find parking) you are in for a tasty treat, especially if you've got a taste for phillipino baked goods.
author: Ken C.

description: Oh my god!  Who knew this place had such wonderful hopia in there.  Seven years ago, I used to catch the 29 up and down Persia St. and always said to myself "This place is still open?  Who the hell comes here?".  I do, you do, we all do!
author: Chai S.

description: BEST hopia and puto I have ever had.  I also ordered the buko pandan and was extremely dissappointed because it tasted pretty bad. Maybe it was old...4 stars!
author: H. A.

description: My family has been ordering their hopia, puto, and kutchinta here for more than 10 years now!  The quality has never changed!
author: Chrysantha C.

description: 4 STARS.  Tradition, tradition.  Hilda's has been and always will be a huge part of our big ole filipino family tribe village parties, for their world-famous KUTCHINTA and "PUTO" (yea, that's what they're really called. i know, i know, it  also means something meaningful in Spanish, si comprende).  They're good because they bake everything fresh, daily and onsite, which is worth YOUR every cash money.  TRUST ME.  Don't ever forget the yummy block of coconut shavings to go with (always buy an extra for backup).  Fo sho, it doesn't hurt to call in advance for party orders especially during the holidays.  BTW, i said it's CASH ONLY, beb.
author: Carmel D.

description: Hilda's bake goods have been a family favorite for years!!!! It's a must at family parties. I suggest you order ahead. They will sell out! Their hopia is the best around!
author: Amy M.

description: Hilda's has been known for their puto and cucinta! They are delectably delicious and are always a staple at every celebration in my family! Better get your order in for Thanksgiving or Christmas --- they stop taking orders two or three weeks before the holiday but they are so bombarded with orders.
author: La C.

description: YUmmmmmm!! the casave cake and espasol are soooo good. I will come back and try more stuff here.
author: rocelle l.

description: They have the BEST hopia in the world.  I drive all the way from San Jose just to get their hopia.  Make sure to order ahead of time because they usually run out.  Puto and kutchinta are also good.  Each hopia is 75 cents but it's worth it.
author: Sheila S.

description: Hilda has really perfected Filipino desserts! It's sooo good that people from around the bay come to this store to bring desserts for family parties. Her daughters are nice, their the ones who work in front most of the time. I live a couple of blocks away from this store, so I can say that I am truly blessed :)
author: Katarina V.

description: It is enough reason to not visit the Philippines for awhile since HILDA satisfies my craving for Filipino sweets. What an amazing bakery! We, San Franciscans, and bay area residents, those who are willing to drive for an hour to buy Hilda's desserts, are so fortunate and spoiled for having access to awesome hopiaZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZ. So sublime.  Yes, buy them when they are hot. If you live close enough to the shop. Quickly drive home, heat up some tea, and enjoy your HOPIA. Eat it with your close eyes and smile each time you chew a piece of it.
author: Magdalena D.

description: Good Filipino delicacies! My favorite is the hopia of course. I'm not sure what they put in it, just similar to what they put in that  krispy kreme glazed donut.  I'm deducting 1 star because I feel like every time I come here, the hopia's price increases jut like Golden gate bakery's custard tarts.
author: JB L.

description: Best hopia I've ever had.  Grew up on this stuff!
author: Lauren S.

description: Let their desserts speak for themselves. It's way better that Goldilocks & Red Ribbon(for all the Pinoys out there!).
author: Jays D.

description: kutsinta is good but kinda pricey.  Try the macaroni salad, yummy too.
author: kyra d.

description: I love this place 3 times a year...Thanksgiving, Christmas and New Year! My family has been buying hopia, puto, and kutsinta for years and it's the best around!
author: Rose E.

description: A little out of the way from Mission Street is this little store right in the corner.  Their puto and kutsinta are the ones I have tasted and they are soooo good.  My sister from Elk Grove would always order them to bring back to their place whenever she's around here in SF.  The price is a bit up there but that's probably the reason why they are soo good, the quality and taste... parking is a bit tough, it's all on-street parking and yes, making reservations is probably a smart thing to do...
author: Surfer S.

description: My folks and I live about a mile away and we usually order just two things: puto and cuchinta. My parents have tried the other stuff and have said it's pretty good. And over the years, prices did go up a bit but you get what you paid for.
author: Conrad C.

description: i've been going here since i was a little kid. this is the place for fresh baked filipino sweets. i love their fresh baked hopias, all kinds. and of course for every party we have we order puto and kuchinta....
author: Justin C.

description:
I tried the hopia because of all the very positive reviews citing it as a top item. I don't agree with those assessments. It's just okay and certainly not worth the price for me. I prefer the style of hopia that Valerio sells. I also bought a couple of empanadas. I don't remember if they were chicken or beef. Anyway, same thing as with the hopia. They're just okay. The last thing I bought was a pack of the ube puto. They're not okay. Too mushy and they tasted half-baked.

If I lived around the corner from the store I'd shop there but since I don't I don't see the point of going out of my way for the things I ate.
author: tom g.

description:
The best place to buy Puto, Kutchinta and Hopia in the bay area.   I recently tried their dinuguan which is also very good.  Goes very well with the puto. 

Aling Hilda's sells mainly dessert items.  Few choices but all are very good.  Price is resonable.  You get what you pay for.
author: R H.

description: Yummmm...hopia.  They make the best hopia in the bay area.  It's a tad expensive but worth it.  You need to go early or call ahead and reserve because they do run out.  Their puto and kutchinta is a staple at our family parties.
author: Josette S.

description:
NO STAR AT ALL if possible but looks like I have to put at least one.  One is too generous of me.

Went there last Sunday at 10:00am, gates were closed.  There were 3 of us waiting and one lady was knocking on the door since they were supposed to be open at 9:00am on Sundays.  After almost an hour a lady with a bad attitude opened the gate.  We felt like it was such a big burden for her to open the gates.  They only had a few packages of cuchinta available.  Asked her if they had any puto, she said none and they're closing because they had to go somewhere.  So she was rushing us to go and leave.  Asked what time they'll be open again she said she didn't know maybe around 1:00pm.  Asked if they were going to have puto she said just come back maybe they'll have but maybe they won't.  While I was talking to her she would walk in and out towards the kitchen.  Can she be more friendly than this?  I've been to this place a few times and have encountered this woman with such bad attitude so unfriendly.  Why do they put people in the counter that seem to not like their job?  I guess this is the last time I am going to this place.  

So for you folks who like their puto go to Claire's Pastry & Restaurant on Mission in DC.  They have the same puto consistency.  Only problem with Claire's you have to order in advance.
author: Joey J.

description: HIlda's makes the best and freshest hopia ever-- perfectly flaky crust and the tastiest bean filling!  The first time I tasted one, I fell in love instantly.  They remind me of hopia from the best bakeries in Ongpin in the Philippines.  Fans of Filipino desserts, look no further.  I've had the puto, kutsinta, and sapin-sapin, but I'm an even bigger fan of the maja blanca and espasol.  These are treats that bring me right back to childhood meriendas in the Philippines.
author: karen c.

description: They make the best hopia hands down.  It's worth the drive and commute traffic from Berkeley anyday.  Just remember to order ahead so as not to be disappointed to arrive and not have any left for your taking.
author: Liz J.

description: Hilda's bakeshop offers great family desserts.  They have the BEST kunchita evr!   Beware on special occassions, esp christmas & new years day.  It gets very packed but the wait is worth it for meeh !!!!
author: aggie t.

description: best hopia and cuchinta ever! itheir cuchinta reminds me of childhood in the philippines. i used to go to Manaog (sp?) with my grandma before going to Baguio and i would always buy the cuchinta there. Hilda's cuchinta brings back memories :)
author: Therese G.

description:
have to 100% agree with everyone - this is the spot to get some great hopia, puto, and kutchinta. and we've been doing since i can remember..

every time there's a family party - these are the staple desserts that were most probably purchased from hilda's! 

ask anyone, everyone knows about the deliciousness at hilda's..
author: L B.

description: best hopia I've ever tasted, nuke it in the microwve for a couple of secs and you're in heaven
author: Michelle E.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!! My family has been ordering from this place since god knows how long. Never disappointed, always frickin' good kutchinta & puto. =)
author: Rachel P.

description: Even if the lady @ the front  who helps customers out is moody this place has the best puto and hopia.
author: Milana S.

description: got my hopia while it's still piping hot. flaky and crumbly.  there is something about the taste that is a bit off like it wasn't seasoned enough. the filling tastes good by itself and they are not stingy with it either. quick service and hopia was packaged nicely. the bakery looks clean, too. for some reason. quite pricey for 75 cents each.
author: poing p.

description: hopia =  perfect consistency, texture, n taste. ...well worth my 75cents! puto & cuchinta = also winners but they didn't give me any coconut along wit it. bibinka = not worth da price given the portion size, otherwise it was only okay. They have a sign saying they also serve dinuguan. Not sure if that's any good.  By the way, it's cash only & they're closed mondays.
author: cj d.
